values.recommendationText: James is an excellent software engineer. One of his key skills - and what I value most about my continued friendship with him - is his ability to share ideas; I always walk away from a conversation with him feeling inspired, more knowledgeable about software engineering and with several topics I feel I should research when I get back home. James would be an asset to any software team.

Jim was a great colleague and friend at Siemens. He had an endless thirst for knowledge and always sought to apply this to current work-based situations. He was always at the forefront of new best practice, championing methods to increase efficiency and effectiveness, but always in a logical and constructive manner. A true team player and not just an 'employee'. He's one sharp chap. Highly recommended.

values.summary: New role within Digital Science! Watch this space.
values.title: Product Manager

values.summary:
Part of two-person team responsible for delivery of SureChem text mining service. Responsibilities include liaising with product manager to determine and prioritise product features, design and development of new text mining and web portal features, and working with other teams to encourage cross-fertilization between Digital Science projects. 

Recently completed the design and development of a new data analytics pipeline built on Amazon Web Services, using cloud-based virtualization, queuing, storage, and database services to provide a fast, scalable, flexible platform for generating text annotations. 

Previously responsible for introducing a ten-fold increase in SureChem chemistry search performance. This involved extensive experimentation with NoSQL technologies such as Riak and MongoDB, though ultimately a custom in-memory solution was developed due to implementation constraints.

Other activities include inception and development of a QA framework to assess the impact of changes in text mining rules across a vast corpus of documents. This was used to solve the difficult project of understanding how changes to text mining rules and technologies affect the correctness of chemical annotation.
values.title: Senior Software Engineer

values.summary:
Responsible for the design and development of a RESTful programming interface for designing WBE applications. This involved early design and prototyping, then extensive Java development using Test Driven Development in the HttpUnit framework, building on core domain model classes to expose secure and highly available REST resources for WBE artefacts. Thread safety was a key concern because of the asynchronous nature of Web 2.0 technologies; the resulting code ensured thread safety by serializing requests using a semaphore.

In addition to supporting direct programmatic access, this interface is the sole means through which a new application design UI communicates with project storage and deployment functionality in WBE 7.0. 

Previously responsible for integration of WBE with other IBM products using HTTP and SOAP, along with the migration of WBE to use the JEE security model. Other activities include ScrumMastering, Agile coaching, test and documentation support, and more recently the delivery of a SupportPac providing an HTML and JavaScript helper for developers using the new REST interface.
values.title: Senior Software Engineer (WebSphere Business Events)

values.summary:
Joined IBM to work as a Software Engineer on WebSphere Application Server. Responsible for the coordination and delivery of a new implementation of the WS-Notification (WS-N) Web Services standard in the latest version of the application server, using JAX-WS and JAXP technologies. This involved leading a small team of software engineers in analysis, design, implementation, testing, and implementation activities.  The new version of WS-N was completed successfully and can be found WebSphere Application Server V7.0 and later versions.

Also responsible for designing and implementing performance enhancements in the WebSphere Java Messaging Service (JMS) implementation, and sustaining activities for the topology and routing management component.
values.title: Senior Software Engineer (WebSphere Application Server)
